meaningMnemonic: Without a <radical>fire</radical>, you will <radical>lack</radical> the ability to <kanji>cook</kanji> anything. You really need a fire to cook properly. Having a fire will make sure any cooking endeavors you attempt will not fail.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>cook</kanji> your meal evenly by <reading>swi</reading>nging (すい) it back and forth over the fire. You swing it left, you swing it right. You swing it to, you swing it fro. All this swinging ensures a properly cooked meal.
